definition: (of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
variant of 附[fu4]
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
ordinary/to use
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
elegant

sentences.english: And I know I may be an artsy person in sb′s eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我知道可能在别人眼里我是个附庸风雅的的人。

sentences.english: The whole arty get-up seemed oddly at variance with the way she behaved.
sentences.chinese: 她那套附庸风雅的穿戴似乎跟她的举止格格不入。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-farty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的电影都是附庸风雅的并且大部分都很长。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-arty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的电影都是附庸风雅的并且大部分都很长。

sentences.english: I wasn't interested in a snob degree.
sentences.chinese: 我对人家附庸风雅的地位没有兴趣。

sentences.english: They run a little pottery shop and cafe and are very arty -crafty.
sentences.chinese: 他们开了一家小陶器店兼咖啡馆，很喜欢附庸风雅。

definition: cultured/sophisticated
scholar/literati
lit. to decorate the front of one's store (idiom)/fig. to embellish (one's CV, etc)/to keep up appearances/to put up a front
refined activities of the intellectuals (regarding literature, paintings etc)
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
lit. singing of the wind and the moon; fig. vacuous and sentimental (of poetry or art)
common people/laity (i.e. not priests)
elegant scholar
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
lit. to wave around one's bookbag (idiom)/fig. to show off one's erudition/a person who does so
intolerably vulgar
see 裝點門面|装点门面[zhuang1 dian3 men2 mian4]
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
scholar/intellectual
folk songs of the state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]/popular art forms (cf. 陽春白雪|阳春白雪[yang2 chun1 bai2 xue3], highbrow art forms)
to show off/to make a display of
